occurrences.text: That as we look through the passage of Scripture and we consider the life and ministry of Paul as it's revealed to us Throughout the Word of God We find that it's this perspective that motivated him that allowed him to be used in the fashion in which he was I am debtor. I mean notice he's he's not even saying to those in Rome that you are indebted He's saying of himself. He's taking the personal responsibility and he's taking it seriously I am mindful even as I read this passage of Scripture and I think about the way in which the Apostle Paul is revealing to us that he is indebted I'm mindful of what the angel said to those shepherds in Luke chapter number two. You'll be mindful that they were there abiding in the field and those Angels that appeared they say that I bring unto you right these glad tidings But it says I bring unto you what shall be to all people this wonderful Proclamation that was given there in Luke 2 was not to just be given to the shepherds and held by the shepherds But they were to go and proclaim That message that Messiah was coming that he was born and we find this This morning that as we look at this passage of Scripture that the gospel the truth of the death burial and resurrection of Jesus Christ has been given to us and we are
